result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy S Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy S Smith is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy S Smith was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Partial payment plan:  $25.00 per month.  5 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.
You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample.
